column2: .NET community has embraced both cross-platform support and open-source. .NET Core open-source and cross-platform implementation of .NET that runs on a plethora of platforms, including Windows, macOS, and various Linux distributions. Xamarin provides Mono, an version of .NET. Mono runs on Android, iOS, and a variety of other form factors, including smart TVs. In 2020, Microsoft released .NET 5 that reconciled .NET Core and Mono into “a runtime and framework that can be used everywhere and that has uniform runtime developer experiences.”

column2: ASP.NET Web Forms benefit from the move to open-source and cross-platform support? answer, unfortunately, is no, or at least not to the same extent as the rest of the platform. The made it clear that ASP.NET Web Forms won’t be ported to .NET Core or .NET 8. Why is

There were efforts in the early days of .NET Core to port ASP.NET Web Forms. The number of changes required were found to be too drastic. There’s also an admission here that even for there’s a limit to the number of web frameworks that it can support simultaneously. Perhaps the community will take up the cause of creating an open-source and cross-platform ASP.NET Web Forms. The source code for ASP.NET Web Forms has been made available reference form. But for the time being, it seems ASP.NET Web Forms will remain without an open-source contribution model. If cross-platform support or open-source important for your scenarios, then you’ll need to look for something new.
